title: CXOwt
text: R package code implement weighted conditional logistic regression described .

title: CXOwt
text: CXOwt still development. can install latest version GitHub :

title: CXOwt
text: CXOwt contains functions case-crossover case-time-control designs. 2 example dataframes, cases casetimecontrols. CXO_wt_boot() version case-crossover studies, CXO_tc_wt_boot() case-time-control studies. return weighted Odds Ratio estimate bootstrapped 95% confidence intervals. Alternatively, can return weighted conditional logistic regression objects without bootstrapping use methods calculating 95% CI. However, recommended.
code: library(CXOwt) #case-crossover data(cases) cfit.b <- CXO_wt_boot(data=cases, exposure = ex, event = Event, Id=Id, B=200)  summary(cfit.b) #case-time-control data(casetimecontrols) ctcfit.b <- CXO_tc_wt_boot(data=casetimecontrols, exposure = ex, event = Event, Id=Id, B = 200)  summary(ctcfit.b) #case-crossover cfit <- CXO_wt(cases, exposure = ex, event = Event, Id=Id)   summary(cfit) #case-time-control ctcfit <- CXO_tc_wt(casetimecontrols, exposure = ex, event = Event, Id=Id)    summary(ctcfit)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Lan Kelly. Author, maintainer. Kiyoshi Kubota. Author. NHMRC grant GNT1157506. Funder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Kelly L, Kubota K (2022). CXOwt: Weighted Conditional Logistic Regression Case-Crossover Case-Time Control Studies. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://github.com/lan-k/CXOwt.
code: @Manual{,   title = {CXOwt: Weighted Conditional Logistic Regression for Case-Crossover and Case-Time Control Studies},   author = {Lan Kelly and Kiyoshi Kubota},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://github.com/lan-k/CXOwt}, }

title: Weighted Conditional Logistic Regression for Case-Crossover and Case-Time Control Studies
text: CXOwt contains functions case-crossover case-time-control designs. 2 example dataframes, cases casetimecontrols. CXO_wt_boot() version case-crossover studies, CXO_tc_wt_boot() case-time-control studies. return weighted Odds Ratio estimate bootstrapped 95% confidence intervals. Alternatively, can return weighted conditional logistic regression objects without bootstrapping:
code: library(CXOwt)  #case-crossover data(cases) cfit.b <- CXO_wt_boot(data=cases, exposure = ex, event = Event, Id=Id, B=500)  summary(cfit.b)  #case-time-control data(casetimecontrols) ctcfit.b <- CXO_tc_wt_boot(data=casetimecontrols, exposure = ex, event = Event, Id=Id, B = 500)  summary(ctcfit.b) #case-crossover cfit <- CXO_wt(cases, exposure = ex, event = Event, Id=Id)   summary(cfit)  #case-time-control ctcfit <- CXO_tc_wt(casetimecontrols, exposure = ex, event = Event, Id=Id)    summary(ctcfit)

what: Weighted conditional logistic regression for case-time-control study — CXO_tc_wt
title: Weighted conditional logistic regression for case-time-control study — CXO_tc_wt
text: Weighted conditional logistic regression case-time-control study

title: Weighted conditional logistic regression for case-time-control study — CXO_tc_wt
Weighted conditional logistic regression for case-time-control study — CXO_tc_wt
text: data input dataframe exposure exposure variable event outcome variable Id person ID

title: Weighted conditional logistic regression for case-time-control study — CXO_tc_wt
Weighted conditional logistic regression for case-time-control study — CXO_tc_wt
code: data(casetimecontrols) ctcfit <- CXO_tc_wt(data=casetimecontrols,exposure=ex,event=Event,Id=Id) summary(ctcfit) #> Call: #> coxph(formula = Surv(rep(1, 56250L), case_period) ~ ex + ex_tc +  #>     strata(Id) + offset(lw), data = cases_wt, method = "efron") #>  #>   n= 56250, number of events= 625  #>  #>            coef exp(coef) se(coef)      z Pr(>|z|)     #> ex1    -0.01725   0.98290  0.16274 -0.106    0.916     #> ex_tc1  0.44988   1.56812  0.10822  4.157 3.22e-05 *** #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 ‘***’ 0.001 ‘**’ 0.01 ‘*’ 0.05 ‘.’ 0.1 ‘ ’ 1 #>  #>        exp(coef) exp(-coef) lower .95 upper .95 #> ex1       0.9829     1.0174    0.7145     1.352 #> ex_tc1    1.5681     0.6377    1.2684     1.939 #>  #> Concordance= 0.583  (se = 0.01 ) #> Likelihood ratio test= 30.34  on 2 df,   p=3e-07 #> Wald test            = 29.95  on 2 df,   p=3e-07 #> Score (logrank) test = 30.44  on 2 df,   p=2e-07 #>

what: Weighted conditional logistic regression for case-time-control with bootstrapped CIs — CXO_tc_wt_boot
title: Weighted conditional logistic regression for case-time-control with bootstrapped CIs — CXO_tc_wt_boot
text: Weighted conditional logistic regression case-time-control bootstrapped CIs

title: Weighted conditional logistic regression for case-time-control with bootstrapped CIs — CXO_tc_wt_boot
code: CXO_tc_wt_boot(data, exposure, event, Id, B = 500, normal = TRUE)

title: Weighted conditional logistic regression for case-time-control with bootstrapped CIs — CXO_tc_wt_boot
text: data input dataframe exposure exposure variable event outcome Id person Id B number bootstrapped replicates, default 500. Minimum 200 recommended normal use normal approximation bootstrapped CI, default TRUE normal = F uses 2.5% 97.% quantiles 95% CI

title: Weighted conditional logistic regression for case-time-control with bootstrapped CIs — CXO_tc_wt_boot
Weighted conditional logistic regression for case-time-control with bootstrapped CIs — CXO_tc_wt_boot
code: # Chop ---------------------------------------------------------------------- data(casetimecontrols) try(CXO_tc_wt_boot(casetimecontrols, exposure = ex, event = Event, Id=Id, B = 3)) #>        Variable      est0      est     lower    upper #> ex1         ex1 0.9828992 1.011920 0.7022699 1.458103 #> ex_tc1   ex_tc1 1.5681218 1.600377 1.4778043 1.733116 # It is recommended that at least 500 bootstrap replications are used # Unchop ---------------------------------------------------------------------- if (FALSE) { CXO_tc_wt_boot(casetimecontrols, exposure = ex, event = Event, Id=Id, B = 1000) }

title: Weighted Conditional Logistic Regression for CXO study — CXO_wt
Weighted Conditional Logistic Regression for CXO study — CXO_wt
code: data(cases) cfit <- CXO_wt(data=cases, exposure=ex, event=Event, Id=Id) summary(cfit) #> Call: #> coxph(formula = Surv(rep(1, 29700L), Event) ~ e + strata(Id) +  #>     offset(lw), data = cases_wt, method = "efron") #>  #>   n= 29700, number of events= 276  #>  #>     coef exp(coef) se(coef)     z Pr(>|z|)    #> e 0.3571    1.4292   0.1215 2.938   0.0033 ** #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 ‘***’ 0.001 ‘**’ 0.01 ‘*’ 0.05 ‘.’ 0.1 ‘ ’ 1 #>  #>   exp(coef) exp(-coef) lower .95 upper .95 #> e     1.429     0.6997     1.126     1.814 #>  #> Concordance= 0.563  (se = 0.015 ) #> Likelihood ratio test= 8.73  on 1 df,   p=0.003 #> Wald test            = 8.63  on 1 df,   p=0.003 #> Score (logrank) test = 8.73  on 1 df,   p=0.003 #>

title: Weighted conditional logistic regression for case-crossover with bootstrapped CIs — CXO_wt_boot
text: data input dataframe exposure exposure variable event outcome variable Id person Id B number bootstrapped replicates, default 500. Minimum 200 recommended normal use normal approximation bootstrapped CI, default TRUE normal = F uses 2.5% 97.% quantiles 95% CI

title: Weighted conditional logistic regression for case-crossover with bootstrapped CIs — CXO_wt_boot
Weighted conditional logistic regression for case-crossover with bootstrapped CIs — CXO_wt_boot
code: # Chop ---------------------------------------------------------------------- data(cases) try(CXO_wt_boot(data=cases, exposure=ex, event=Event, Id = Id, B=3)) #>   Variable     est0      est    lower   upper #> e        e 1.429248 1.354135 1.158315 1.58306 # It is recommended that at least 500 bootstrap replications are used # Unchop ---------------------------------------------------------------------- if (FALSE) { CXO_wt_boot(data=cases, exposure=ex, event=Event, Id = Id, B=1000) }
